001    package net.jmatrix.eproperties.cache;
002    
003    import java.io.*;
004    import java.net.*;
005    import java.text.*;
006    import java.util.Date;
007    
008    import javax.net.ssl.HttpsURLConnection;
009    
010    import net.jmatrix.eproperties.utils.URLUtil;
011    
012    import org.apache.commons.logging.*;
013    
014    /**
015     * The CacheManager implements many simple functions necessary for caching
016     * properties.  Properties are cached for safe failover to the most 
017     * recently used values in the case of failure of network based resources.
018     * Network based resources could include: http or NFS file URLs, or JDBC based
019     * properties, or indeed any custom derrived properties includer.
020     *
021     * Properties loaded with non-stream based loading (such as Method based
022     * proeprties inclusion) are not cached. 
023     *
024     * To maintain transparency, we will use a Tee type input stream bound to a
025     * buffered writer to minimize performance impacts.
026     * 
027     * System Properties: <br>
028     * eproperties.cache:  If set to anything other than "true", the cache is 
029     *    disabled for the life of the JVM.  Only read at the first call to 
030     *    CacheManager.getInstance(), called internally before any EProperties load 
031     *    operation.  Default: true<br>
032     *    
033     * eproperties.cache.root: Sets the cache root folder.  
034     *    Default: ${user.home}/.eproperties/cache/
035     */
036    public class CacheManager {
037       static final Log log=LogFactory.getLog(CacheManager.class);
038       
039       static CacheManager instance=null;
040       
041       static final String CACHE_ROOT_PROPERTY="eproperties.cache.root";
042       
043       /** It is enabled by default, but will be disabled (for the life of the 
044        * JVM) if this is set to "false".  
045        * 
046        * There is no lifecycle management.  At the time that CacheManager.getInstance() 
047        * is called - if this _system_ property is set to false, then the 
048        * CacheManager will be 'disabled' any you cannot re-enable it at runtime.
049        * 
050        * The CacheManager is either on or off for the life of the JVM.  Unless
051        * someone can explain a need for a more complex behavior.  
052        * 
053        * Paul Bemowski, 30jul2010.
054        */
055       static final String EPROPERTIES_CACHE="eproperties.cache";
056       
057       File cacheRoot=null;
058       
059       /* 
060        * This depends on the target system.  If the filesystem is NFS or otherwise
061        * network based, then creating a local disk cache of file URLs makes sense.
062        * However if the filesystem is local disk - cacheing such URLs is redundant, 
063        * wasteful, and can lead to errors.  (Ie, FileNotFound may be more valid
064        * than running with a cached file.)  
065        */
066       boolean CACHE_FILE_URLS=false;
067       
068       boolean online=true;
069       
070       String state="ONLINE";
071       
072       /** */
073       private CacheManager() {
074          String enabled=System.getProperty(EPROPERTIES_CACHE, "true");
075          
076          if (enabled.equals("true")) {
077             if (System.getProperty(CACHE_ROOT_PROPERTY) != null) {
078                cacheRoot=new File(System.getProperty(CACHE_ROOT_PROPERTY));
079             } else {
080                cacheRoot=new File(System.getProperty("user.home")+"/.eproperties/cache/");
081             }
082             log.debug("EProperties: CacheManager root at "+cacheRoot);
083             
084             if (!cacheRoot.exists()) {
085                boolean success=cacheRoot.mkdirs();
086                
087                if (!success) {
088                   online=false;
089                   state="Cannot create cache root dir at "+
090                         cacheRoot.getAbsolutePath();
091                   log.error(state);
092                   log.error("CacheManager will be unavilable for read/write property caching.");
093                }
094             }
095             
096             if (!cacheRoot.canWrite()) {
097                online=false;
098                state="Cannot write in cache dir.  CacheManager unavailable.";
099                log.error(state);
100                log.error("CacheManager will be unavilable for read/write property caching.");
101             }
102          } else {
103             online=false;
104             state="Disabled by system property (eproperties.cache != true)";
105          }
106          
107          log.debug("EProperties: CacheManager state: "+state);
108       }
109       
110       /** */
111       public static CacheManager getInstance() {
112          if (instance == null) {
113             synchronized(CacheManager.class) {
114                if (instance == null) {
115                   instance=new CacheManager();
116                }
117             }
118          }
119          return instance;
120       }
121       
122       /**
123        * This method will return an input stream based on a URL.
124        * 
125        * In the case where the stream IS available from the URL, the contents
126        * of that stream will be cached.  In the case where the steram is NOT 
127        * available, we will attempt to get the stream from the cache.
128        * 
129        * @param url
130        * @return
131        */
132       public InputStream getInputStream(URL url) throws IOException {
133          if (url == null) {
134             throw new IOException ("Cannot open input stream for null URL.");
135          }
136          
137          if (!online) {
138             URLConnection urlConn=URLUtil.getConnection(url);
139             return urlConn.getInputStream();
140          }
141          
142          InputStream pis=null;
143          String surl=url.toExternalForm();
144          
145          File cacheFile=getCacheFileForURL(url);
146          
147          log.debug("CacheFile: "+cacheFile.getAbsolutePath());
148          
149          try {
150             URLConnection urlConn=URLUtil.getConnection(url);
151             
152    //         log.debug("URLConnection is a "+urlConn.getClass().getName());
153    //         if (urlConn instanceof HttpsURLConnection) {
154    //            log.debug("Connection is a javax.net.ssl.HttpsURLConnection");
155    //         }
156             
157             InputStream ris=urlConn.getInputStream();
158             
159             // Ok, we have an input stream, so lets create a cache stream
160             // and return it.
161             try {
162                OutputStream cos=getCacheOutputStream(surl, cacheFile);
163                CacheInputStream cis=new CacheInputStream(ris, cos);
164                
165                //cis.setLastModified(lastMod);
166                pis=cis;
167             } catch (Exception ex) {
168                // Can't create cache file or stream.
169                log.warn("Cannot create cache output stream with file "+cacheFile);
170                log.debug("Continuing with remote input stream as properties stream. Uncached.");
171                pis=ris;
172             }
173          } catch (IOException ex) {
174             log.warn("Remote stream unavailable for URL "+url+" due to "+ex.toString());
175             log.warn("Looking for cache file at "+cacheFile.getAbsolutePath());
176             //log.debug("Remote stream stack: ", ex);
177    
178             if (cacheFile.exists() && cacheFile.canRead()) {
179                log.info("Cache file "+cacheFile.getAbsolutePath()+" exists. Attempting to use.");
180                DateFormat df=new SimpleDateFormat("dd.MMM.yyyy HH:mm:ss");
181                log.info("Cache file lastMod is "+df.format(new Date(cacheFile.lastModified())));
182                FileInputStream fis=new FileInputStream(cacheFile);
183                pis=new CacheInputStream(fis, null);
184             } else {
185                throw ex;
186                //throw new IOException("Properties cache file does not exist at "+
187                //      cacheFile.getAbsolutePath()+" for URL "+url);
188             }
189          }
190          
191          return pis;
192       }
193       
194       /** MUST be called before getInstance().  
195        * Sets the system property eproperties.cache to false.*/
196       public static final void disable() {
197          if (instance != null) {
198             log.error("CacheManager: Call to disable() after CacheManager instance already created.  Disabling. Cannot re-enable.");
199             
200             // This was mostly added for unit tests.
201             instance.online=false;
202             instance.state="Offline, disabled by static method call.";
203          } else {
204             System.setProperty(EPROPERTIES_CACHE, "false");
205          }
206       }
207       
208       /** */
209       public InputStream getInputStream(InputStream is, URL url) {
210          return getInputStream(is, (url == null? null:url.toExternalForm()));
211       }
212       
213       /** */
214       public InputStream getInputStream(InputStream is, String surl) {
215          if (!online)
216             return is;
217          
218          if (surl == null)
219             return is;
220          
221          // This is already a cache stream.
222          if (is instanceof CacheInputStream)
223             return is;
224          
225          File cacheFile=getCacheFileForURLString(surl);
226          log.debug("CacheFile: "+cacheFile.getAbsolutePath());
227          
228          InputStream pis=null;
229          // Ok, we have an input stream, so lets create a cache stream
230          // and return it.
231          try {
232             OutputStream cos=getCacheOutputStream(surl, cacheFile);
233             CacheInputStream cis=new CacheInputStream(is, cos);
234             pis=cis;
235          } catch (Exception ex) {
236             // Can't create cache file or stream.
237             log.warn("Cannot create cache output stream with file "+cacheFile);
238             log.debug("Continuing with remote input stream as properties stream. Uncached.");
239             pis=is;
240          }
241          return pis;
242       }
243       
244       /**
245        * Here we create a .pcache file by translating the full URL into a 
246        * directory structure.
247        **/
248       private File getCacheFileForURL(URL url) {
249          String surl=url.toExternalForm();
250          return getCacheFileForURLString(surl);
251       }
252       
253       /** */
254       private File getCacheFileForURLString(String surl) {
255          surl=surl.replace("\\", "/");
256          surl=surl.replace("//", "/");
257          surl=surl.replace(":/", "/");
258          surl=surl.replace(":", "-");
259          
260          String filename=null;
261          String path=null;
262          if (!surl.contains("/")) {
263             filename=surl+".pcache";
264             path="";
265          }
266          if (surl.endsWith("/")) {
267             filename="index.pcache";
268             path=surl;
269          } else {
270             filename=surl.substring(surl.lastIndexOf("/")+1)+".pcache"; 
271             path=surl.substring(0, surl.lastIndexOf("/"));
272          }
273          
274          File file=new File(cacheRoot, path+"/"+filename);
275          try {
276             file=file.getCanonicalFile();
277          } catch (IOException ex) {
278             // this should really never happen...
279             log.warn("Cannot form canonical file for file: "+file.getAbsolutePath());
280          }
281          
282          return file;
283       }
284       
285       /** */
286       private OutputStream getCacheOutputStream(String surl, File cacheFile) 
287       throws IOException {
288          FileOutputStream fos=null;
289          if (surl.startsWith("file")) {
290             if (CACHE_FILE_URLS) {
291                createDirsForFile(cacheFile);
292                fos=new FileOutputStream(cacheFile, false);
293             }
294          } else {
295             createDirsForFile(cacheFile);
296             fos=new FileOutputStream(cacheFile, false);
297          }
298          return fos;
299       }
300       
301       /** */
302       private void createDirsForFile(File f) {
303          File dir=f.getParentFile();
304          if (dir.exists()) 
305             return;
306          dir.mkdirs();
307       }
308    }
